name: Iliac Artery Entrapment Syndrome
chief_complaint: I get this sharp pain in my lower abdomen and leg when I walk, but it goes away when I rest
physical_findings: Diminished femoral pulse with hip extension
prognosis: Good with surgical intervention, though recurrence possible if anatomical abnormalities persist
description: A rare vascular compression syndrome where the iliac artery becomes compressed by surrounding musculoskeletal structures during certain movements, leading to intermittent ischemia. Most common in young, athletic individuals.
